comment.author: 57873306@N00
comment._content: Is this where the old Catelli factory is?

comment.author: 23686862@N03
comment._content:
Belinda Crowson has provided the following:

They were in a similar area but not in the exact same spot. The 1914 Henderson Directory says there were four buildings on the west side of 13th Street North between the railway track and 2nd Avenue North:
Columbia Flouring Mills Co Ltd (closed at the time)
Fire Hall No 2
Western Transfer Co Ltd.
CPR Freight Sheds

The area where Canadian Tire, Block Buster, etc. are located today is where these four buildings would have fit. The CPR freight sheds were tucked in behind and to the west.  The fire station was a little more to the north.

The Catelli address was 104 - 13 Street North, so in the same general vicinity but a little more east and a little more south than the location of the CPR Freight sheds.
comment.authorname: Galt Museum & Archives on The Commons
